deepof.model_utils.embedding_model_fittingÔÉÅ

deepof.model_utils.embedding_model_fitting(preprocessed_object: Tuple[ndarray, ndarray, ndarray, ndarray], adjacency_matrix: ndarray, embedding_model: str, encoder_type: str, batch_size: int, latent_dim: int, epochs: int, log_history: bool, log_hparams: bool, n_components: int, output_path: str, kmeans_loss: float, pretrained: str, save_checkpoints: bool, save_weights: bool, input_type: str, kl_annealing_mode: str, kl_warmup: int, reg_cat_clusters: float, recluster: bool, temperature: float, contrastive_similarity_function: str, contrastive_loss_function: str, beta: float, tau: float, interaction_regularization: float, run: int = 0, **kwargs)ÔÉÅ

Trains the specified embedding model on the preprocessed data.

Parameters:

  • coordinates (np.ndarray) ‚Äì Coordinates of the data.

  • preprocessed_object (tuple) ‚Äì Tuple containing the preprocessed data.

  • adjacency_matrix (np.ndarray) ‚Äì adjacency_matrix (np.ndarray): adjacency matrix of the connectivity graph to use.

  • embedding_model (str) ‚Äì Model to use to embed and cluster the data. Must be one of VQVAE (default), VaDE, and contrastive.

  • encoder_type (str) ‚Äì Encoder architecture to use. Must be one of ‚Äúrecurrent‚Äù, ‚ÄúTCN‚Äù, and ‚Äútransformer‚Äù.

  • batch_size (int) ‚Äì Batch size to use for training.

  • latent_dim (int) ‚Äì Encoding size to use for training.

  • epochs (int) ‚Äì Number of epochs to train the autoencoder for.

  • log_history (bool) ‚Äì Whether to log the history of the autoencoder.

  • log_hparams (bool) ‚Äì Whether to log the hyperparameters used for training.

  • n_components (int) ‚Äì Number of components to fit to the data.

  • output_path (str) ‚Äì Path to the output directory.

  • kmeans_loss (float) ‚Äì Weight of the gram loss, which adds a regularization term to VQVAE models which penalizes the correlation between the dimensions in the latent space.

  • pretrained (str) ‚Äì Path to the pretrained weights to use for the autoencoder.

  • save_checkpoints (bool) ‚Äì Whether to save checkpoints during training.

  • save_weights (bool) ‚Äì Whether to save the weights of the autoencoder after training.

  • input_type (str) ‚Äì Input type of the TableDict objects used for preprocessing. For logging purposes only.

  • interaction_regularization (float) ‚Äì Weight of the interaction regularization term (L1 penalization to all features not related to interactions).

  • run (int) ‚Äì Run number to use for logging.

  • parameters (# Contrastive Model specific) ‚Äì

  • kl_annealing_mode (str) ‚Äì Mode to use for KL annealing. Must be one of ‚Äúlinear‚Äù (default), or ‚Äúsigmoid‚Äù.

  • kl_warmup (int) ‚Äì Number of epochs during which KL is annealed.

  • reg_cat_clusters (bool) ‚Äì whether to penalize uneven cluster membership in the latent space, by minimizing the KL divergence between cluster membership and a uniform categorical distribution.

  • recluster (bool) ‚Äì Whether to recluster the data after each training using a Gaussian Mixture Model.

  • parameters ‚Äì

  • temperature (float) ‚Äì temperature parameter for the contrastive loss functions. Higher values put harsher penalties on negative pair similarity.

  • contrastive_similarity_function (str) ‚Äì similarity function between positive and negative pairs. Must be one of ‚Äòcosine‚Äô (default), ‚Äòeuclidean‚Äô, ‚Äòdot‚Äô, and ‚Äòedit‚Äô.

  • contrastive_loss_function (str) ‚Äì contrastive loss function. Must be one of ‚Äònce‚Äô (default), ‚Äòdcl‚Äô, ‚Äòfc‚Äô, and ‚Äòhard_dcl‚Äô. See specific documentation for details.

  • beta (float) ‚Äì Beta (concentration) parameter for the hard_dcl contrastive loss. Higher values lead to ‚Äòharder‚Äô negative samples.

  • tau (float) ‚Äì Tau parameter for the dcl and hard_dcl contrastive losses, indicating positive class probability.

Returns:

List of trained models corresponding to the selected model class. The full trained model is last.
